page.title: 14Littleton Wharf
page.content: In Littleton Wharf we walked along a path and came to a boat slipway. We saw the Severn Bridge from the Severn Barrier which is man-made. The Barrier which we were walking along was to stop the Severn flooding the fields. We also saw Oldbury Nuclear Power Staton. In the fields we noticed drainage ditches or rhines. There was a bridge going across the drainage ditch. As we walked we saw cracks in the ground. When the river is at high tide it makes the ground soggy which causes cracks when it dries. Our teacher pointed out that the River Severn is the largest river in Great Britain.
